title: Naunspitze
text:
The Naunspitze is a peak in the Zahmer Kaiser, the northern ridge of the <a href="Kaiser%20Mountains">Kaiser Mountains</a> in <a href="Tyrol%20%28state%29">Tyrol</a>, <a href="Austria">Austria</a>. Seen from the west it is the first independent summit on the main crest. To the south it falls sharply away and, to the north, ends abruptly in a steep rock face that towers over the <a href="Inn%20valley">Inn valley</a> near <a href="Ebbs">Ebbs</a>. The next peak along the main ridge to the east is the <a href="Petersk%C3%B6pfl">Petersköpfl</a> (1745m), which is separated from the Naunspitze by a small wind gap.
Ascents.
The Naunspitze may be reached without difficulty in about 45 minutes from the <a href="Vorderkaiserfelden%20Hut">Vorderkaiserfelden Hut</a> to the southwest, or in 20 minutes from the Petersköpfl. Several Alpine climbing routes lead up the rock faces to the north and west classified by the <a href="UIAA">UIAA</a> as grade III.
